alert.note: Alert for Cass; Morgan; Schuyler; Scott (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of west central Illinois, including the following counties, Cass, Morgan, Schuyler and Scott. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected to move into west central Illinois after midnight, and will continue through about 8 AM. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely with the heavier storms. While conditions have been dry as of late, these heavy rates will likely cause areas of flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
